page.title: 06ABOVE TOWN,DARTMOUTH
page.content: At the South end of the road,houses were built in the grounds of Stoke Cliff House.One was built in 1935 in the'functional' style.It has a plain front,flat roof,white brick walls and wood-frame windows,except for the new double-glazed patio window.There is a steep back garden which leads up to a thick woods.Robins,squirrels and slow- worms come into the garden,once 2 cows wandered in to eat the cabbages.The front terrace has lovely rose beds and a wide view of Kingswear and the sea. Some houses are Edwardian,they have decorated windows,balconies and gables.The rooms have high ceilings and it can be quite draughty in the winter.The gardens are steep but beautifully kept.One big problem here is parking.We met the road sweeper,who said his big problem is dogs.Also,in Autumn he wears out 1 broom in 1 week.
